### Monitors_Create
{{% example csharp %}}
```csharp
using Pulumi;
using AzureNative = Pulumi.AzureNative;

class MyStack : Stack
{
    public MyStack()
    {
        var monitor = new AzureNative.Datadog.Monitor("monitor", new AzureNative.Datadog.MonitorArgs
        {
            MonitorName = "myMonitor",
            ResourceGroupName = "myResourceGroup",
        });
    }

}

```

{{% /example %}}

{{% example go %}}

```go
package main

import (
	datadog "github.com/pulumi/pulumi-azure-native/sdk/go/azure/datadog"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v2/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := datadog.NewMonitor(ctx, "monitor", &datadog.MonitorArgs{
			MonitorName:       pulumi.String("myMonitor"),
			ResourceGroupName: pulumi.String("myResourceGroup"),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}

```

        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Email of the user used by Datadog for contacting them if needed{{% /md %}}</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="name_python">
<a href="#name_python" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Name of the user{{% /md %}}</dd>
    <dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="phone_number_python">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">str</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>{{% md %}}Phone number of the user used by Datadog for contacting them if needed{{% /md %}}</dd>
</dl>
{{% /choosable %}}
## Import


An existing resource can be imported using its type token, name, and identifier, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import azure-native:datadog:Monitor myMonitor /subscriptions/00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000/resourceGroups/myResourceGroup/monitors/myMonitor 
```
